intro: Chirita pinnatifida, commonly known as the broad-leaved chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Chirita pinnatifida is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
